page.title: 03Farming
page.content: Agriculture is highly mechanised and represents the most modern farming technology.The latest development is the rotary hay bailer which has replaced the smaller rectangular bailer which in its turn replaced the traditional haystack.Fields are large and farm size averages well over 100 acres.Crops grown include winter and spring wheat,barley,peas,rape and greenhouse crops.Some farms sell milk, eggs and saled crops in small quantities to supplement their regular income.Familiar landmarks on the horizon include Dutch Barns and metal silos used to store either livestock fodder or next year's seed.Dairy cattle are often seen grazing on the flat,wetter areas close to the River Rib.
